intro: Malvastrum diminutivum, commonly known as the small mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate with a soft, hairy texture, and the stems are hairy as well. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping in arid regions.
